intro: Nintooa japonica, commonly known as the Japanese bellflower, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces striking blue to violet flowers in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in partial shade to full sun. Its flowers are clustered in racemes, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Nintooa japonica is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
